{"id":518716301,"lang":"cpp","time":"2 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1625653046,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"12 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/518716301/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"58.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    void inorderTraversal(vector<TreeNode*>& data, TreeNode* root) {\n        if(!root) return;\n        inorderTraversal(data, root->left);\n        data.push_back(root);\n        inorderTraversal(data, root->right);\n    }\n    \n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        vector<TreeNode*> inorder;\n        inorderTraversal(inorder, root);\n        int n = inorder.size();\n        for(int i = n - 1; i > 0; --i) {\n            if(inorder[i]->val < inorder[i - 1]->val) {\n                int j = i - 1;\n                while(j >= 0 && inorder[i]->val < inorder[j]->val) --j;\n                \n                swap(inorder[i]->val, inorder[j + 1]->val);\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
